intro: Arkezostis podantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in early spring. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
